text: Even the decorative persimmon was delicious!

The pizza is terrible, but if you need a place to watch a game or just down some pitchers, this place works.

Oh, and the pasta is even worse than the pizza.

Awww! someone added this business before i could! 

Anyways, haha, I really like this place! Specially their fried rice. I really dislike mushy types of fried rice, but Pekin Express's wasn't! 

I really like their  garlic string beans, and sauted spinach! The best of all is that they are offering a special opening deal.  3 items for $5 ! 

Like all Chinese food, food is a bit greasy, but thats part of its yumminess ^^ Thy have over 15 dishes you can choose from. Ranging from grilled chicken, lemon chicken, mapo tofu, veggies, beef etc, 3 types of fried rice ( veggie, pork, chicken)  and 2 types of chow mein( veggie, chicken) !

This place has lots of options for vegetarians !!

Cheap, fast, convenient and tasty chinese food all in one place.

The place is HUGE, so you can come with a bunch of friends! 

Service is also really friendly, and THEY ACCEPT CREDIT CARDS :) So if you never have cash handy ( like me ), and your bank is NOT bofa, then this is the place to go for a quick bite!

Only good if you have meal points. Otherwise everything's inflated. Yeah that sandwich is $7.00. Protip: go outside, turn right into lower sproul and go to the Coffee Spot and get a sandwich for $3.75. The prepared sandwiches at GBC are all the same, and still stingier than the Coffee Spot. The hot food is greasy and unsatisfying. Odwalla is still $4.00. Then again Odwalla was never cheap. Yeah, so only go there if you have meal points.

This was the first Korean place that I tried around Berkeley that was good enough to make me want to come back, and this is the one place where a lot of my non-Korean place like to go for Korean food. Owner is always nice, order comes out pretty fast, lots of selection. I always go for the spicy tofu soup because I like soup, and I like spicy. You can tell them whether you want it mild, spicy, or extra spicy.
Few drawbacks: some koreans say they can taste excessive seasoning (which isn't healthy.. forgot what they're called) and they avoid this place. As for me, I guess I've went too much to notice. Also, they only take CASH if your order isn't over like $10 or something. So make sure to take cash with you!

For the price paid, and the proximity to campus, the sushi is not bad. I always get the caterpillar roll and I like it. Of course, there are much better places, but if you don't wanna go far from campus, then Tako Sushi is adequate
